{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3595445,"name":"Ray Flanagan","username":"FloppyDks","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/2acd7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-18T12:59:03.005Z","cooked":"

What can be shared over robot wifi? Are there any limitations to how much data can be sent? Is it protected?

I’m thinking of creating a utility app for practices and collaboration that would use the robot wifi. Just wondering if this would even be possible.

R704 has many of the details that you seek.

Not entirely sure what you’re asking- what access point setup do you have? It varies wildly based on how you have your practice field setup- are you just running a VH-109 in 2.4ghz AP mode? Are you running a second AP as a 6ghz field-side AP? Do you have a switch?

Also, what are you trying to accomplish? That’ll help us answer your question

See R704:

frctools.com

Rule R704

R704       *Only use allowed ports and bandwidth to communicate with the ROBOT. Communication between the ROBOT and the OPERATOR CONSOLE may not exceed the following and is restricted to network ports listed in Table...

For practice, the bandwidth limit and firewall can be disabled.

Sorry, I wasn’t very clear in my question…

I am looking to create a utility app (something like AdvantageKit or Pathplanner) for teams to use. When I said “practice” I meant during build times or off-season. Not actual practice matches.

Hoping to use the wireless connection from the radio, and have multiple students connect to it. Essentially connecting the two students together.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-04-18T13:22:54.055Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499658,"topic_slug":"what-can-be-shared-over-robot-wifi","display_username":"Ray Flanagan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":57939,"username":"grahamsh","name":"Graham Howard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/grahamsh/{size}/188294_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68236,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-can-be-shared-over-robot-wifi/499658/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3595464,"name":"Sam Weaver","username":"weaversam8","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weaversam8/{size}/11341_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-18T13:24:53.581Z","cooked":"

Connecting multiple students to the same robot network wirelessly isn’t possible when you’re competing at an event. It’s not possible for even one person to connect directly.

Once you’ve joined an event and flashed your radio, it’ll only connect to the field, not your phone or laptop.

I’d suggest looking into NetworkTables, which should get you started with pretty easy device → robot → device communications. There are a bunch of client libraries out there, but their quality does vary a bit.
